sn46.52:4.1: Then several mendicants got dressed in the morning and, taking their bowls and robes, entered Sāvatthī for alms.
sn46.52:4.3: “It’s too early to wander for alms in Sāvatthī.
sn46.52:4.4: Why don’t we go to the monastery of the wanderers who follow other paths?”
sn46.52:5.1: Then they went to the monastery of the wanderers who follow other paths,
sn46.52:5.2: and exchanged greetings with the wanderers there.
sn46.52:5.3: When the greetings and polite conversation were over, they sat down to one side.
sn46.52:6.1: “Reverends, the ascetic Gotama teaches his disciples like this:
sn46.52:6.2: ‘Mendicants, please give up the five hindrances—corruptions of the heart that weaken wisdom—and truly develop the seven factors of awakening.’
sn46.52:6.4: ‘Reverends, please give up the five hindrances—corruptions of the heart that weaken wisdom—and truly develop the seven factors of awakening.’
sn46.52:6.5: What, then, is the difference between the ascetic Gotama’s teaching and instruction and ours?”
sn46.52:7.1: Those mendicants neither approved nor dismissed that statement of the wanderers who follow other paths.
sn46.52:7.2: They got up from their seat, thinking:
sn46.52:7.3: “We will learn the meaning of this statement from the Buddha himself.”
sn46.52:7.4: Then, after the meal, when they returned from alms-round, they went up to the Buddha,
sn46.52:7.5: bowed, sat down to one side,
sn46.52:7.6: and told him what had happened.
sn46.52:11.1: “Mendicants, when wanderers who follow other paths say this, you should say to them:
sn46.52:11.2: ‘But reverends, is there a way in which the five hindrances become ten and the seven awakening factors become fourteen?’
sn46.52:11.3: Questioned like this, the wanderers who follow other paths would be stumped, and, in addition, would get frustrated.
sn46.52:11.5: Because they’re out of their element.
sn46.52:11.6: I don’t see anyone in this world—with its gods, Māras, and Brahmās, this population with its ascetics and brahmins, its gods and humans—who could provide a satisfying answer to these questions except for the Realized One or his disciple or someone who has heard it from them.
sn46.52:12.1: And what is the way in which the five hindrances become ten?
sn46.52:12.2: Sensual desire for what is internal is a hindrance; and sensual desire for what is external is also a hindrance.
sn46.52:12.3: That’s how what is concisely referred to as ‘the hindrance of sensual desire’ becomes twofold.
sn46.52:12.5: Ill will for what is internal is a hindrance; and ill will for what is external is also a hindrance.
sn46.52:12.6: That’s how what is concisely referred to as ‘the hindrance of ill will’ becomes twofold.
sn46.52:12.8: Dullness is a hindrance; and drowsiness is also a hindrance.
sn46.52:12.9: That’s how what is concisely referred to as ‘the hindrance of dullness and drowsiness’ becomes twofold.
sn46.52:12.11: Restlessness is a hindrance; and remorse is also a hindrance.
sn46.52:12.12: That’s how what is concisely referred to as ‘the hindrance of restlessness and remorse’ becomes twofold.
sn46.52:12.14: Doubt about internal things is a hindrance; and doubt about external things is also a hindrance.
sn46.52:12.15: That’s how what is concisely referred to as ‘the hindrance of doubt’ becomes twofold.
sn46.52:12.17: This is the way in which the five hindrances become ten.
sn46.52:13.1: And what is the way in which the seven awakening factors become fourteen?
sn46.52:13.2: Mindfulness of internal things is the awakening factor of mindfulness; and mindfulness of external things is also the awakening factor of mindfulness.
sn46.52:13.3: That’s how what is concisely referred to as ‘the awakening factor of mindfulness’ becomes twofold.
sn46.52:14.1: Investigating, exploring, and inquiring into internal things with wisdom is the awakening factor of investigation of principles; and investigating, exploring, and inquiring into external things with wisdom is also the awakening factor of investigation of principles
sn46.52:14.2: That’s how what is concisely referred to as ‘the awakening factor of investigation of principles’ becomes twofold.
sn46.52:15.1: Physical energy is the awakening factor of energy; and mental energy is also the awakening factor of energy.
sn46.52:15.2: That’s how what is concisely referred to as ‘the awakening factor of energy’ becomes twofold.
sn46.52:16.1: Rapture while placing the mind and keeping it connected is the awakening factor of rapture; and rapture without placing the mind and keeping it connected is also the awakening factor of rapture.
sn46.52:16.2: In this way what is concisely referred to as ‘the awakening factor of rapture’ becomes twofold.
sn46.52:17.1: Physical tranquility is the awakening factor of tranquility; and mental tranquility is also the awakening factor of tranquility.
sn46.52:17.2: In this way what is concisely referred to as ‘the awakening factor of tranquility’ becomes twofold.
sn46.52:18.1: Samādhi while placing the mind and keeping it connected is the awakening factor of samādhi; and samādhi without placing the mind and keeping it connected is also the awakening factor of samādhi.
sn46.52:18.2: In this way what is concisely referred to as ‘the awakening factor of samādhi’ becomes twofold.
sn46.52:19.1: Equanimity for internal things is the awakening factor of equanimity; and equanimity for external things is also the awakening factor of equanimity.
sn46.52:19.2: In this way what is concisely referred to as ‘the awakening factor of equanimity’ becomes twofold.
sn46.52:19.4: This is the way in which the seven awakening factors become fourteen.”
